originalTitle: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
title: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
content: This is the highest number of confirmed casualties from a single African country in the Ukraine-Russia war.

title: Former US diplomat sentenced to life for abusing two girls in Burkina Faso
content: He used the girls' mother's life-threatening illness as an opportunity to demand sex, said the US Office of Public Affairs.

originalTitle: Epstein tried to buy a palace in Morocco days before his arrest in 2019
title: Big News from Sunny Morocco! A Palace, a Problem, and Our African Home!
content:
Hello from Africa, My Little Friends!

Hello, hello, my wonderful young explorers and news readers! It's your friendly reporter, coming to you live from our amazing continent of Africa! I hope you're all having a super day, full of smiles and adventures. Today, I have a very interesting story for you. It's about a man, a big, big house, and a country called Morocco. Morocco is a beautiful country right here in Africa! Sometimes, the news can be a bit tricky, but I promise to tell you this story in the easiest way, just for you!

A Big House Story!

Imagine a house so big it looks like a castle! A house with many, many rooms, big gardens, and maybe even a sparkling swimming pool. Well, that's called a palace! A few years ago, in 2019, a man named Mr. Epstein wanted to buy one of these amazing palaces. He wanted to buy it in Morocco. It was called Bin Ennakhi. Sounds fancy, right? He was talking to people about buying this very grand palace. He really wanted it to be his. But guess what? He never got to buy it!

Who Was This Man, Mr. Epstein?

Now, about this Mr. Epstein. He was a man who used to have a lot of money. But sometimes, even people with lots of money can do bad things. Mr. Epstein was one of those people. He had broken important rules and done things that were not kind or right. Because of this, he was in big trouble with the law. People were very unhappy with what he had done. **Did you know?** Just like at school, we have rules to keep everyone safe and happy. When grown-ups break very important rules, the police step in to help make things right.

What is a Palace, Really?

Think about the biggest, fanciest house you have ever seen. Now, make it even bigger! A palace is usually a very grand home where kings, queens, or very important people might live. They have lots of space, beautiful decorations, and sometimes special rooms for parties or important meetings. Imagine running around in a garden bigger than your school playground! This palace, Bin Ennakhi, was just like that. It was a very fancy and expensive house. Many people would dream of living in such a place. **Did you know?** There are many beautiful palaces all over the world, including some really old and famous ones right here in Africa! Some of them are open for visitors to see what life was like for kings and queens long ago.

Where is Morocco?

Morocco is a super cool country in North Africa. It's famous for its sunny weather, colourful markets called souks, and delicious food like tagine. Imagine riding a camel in the desert or seeing tall mountains! Morocco is full of amazing sights and sounds. The people of Morocco are known for being very welcoming and kind. This palace that Mr. Epstein wanted was in a lovely part of Morocco. It's a place where many people love to visit and enjoy the sunshine. **Did you know?** Morocco is home to the Atlas Mountains, which are very tall and beautiful! And if you ever visit, you might even see some special goats that climb trees to eat leaves!

The Palace Mr. Epstein Wanted

The palace, Bin Ennakhi, was not just any house. It was described as a 'luxury abode.' This means it was extra special, very grand, and cost a lot of money. It probably had many rooms, beautiful courtyards, and lovely views. Mr. Epstein thought he could just buy this amazing place, like buying a toy from a shop. He was making plans and talking about it. He probably imagined living there. But life doesn't always go as planned, especially when you have done wrong things. Good things often happen when we are kind and follow the rules.

Why Didn't He Get It?

Here's the important part! Just a few days before he could buy the palace, something big happened. Mr. Epstein was arrested. The police caught him! When someone is arrested, it means the police take them because they have done bad things and broken the law. It's how the police keep everyone safe and make sure justice is done. Because he was arrested, all his plans to buy the beautiful palace in Morocco stopped. The sale was never completed. He didn't get to live in that grand house. **Did you know?** Police officers are brave people who work hard to protect us and keep our communities safe. They make sure everyone follows the rules so we can all live happily together.

Good News for Everyone!

This is good news because it shows that even if someone has a lot of money, they cannot just do what they want if it's wrong. The rules apply to everyone. It means that the beautiful land of Morocco, a part of our wonderful Africa, did not become home to someone who had done bad things. The palace stayed without him. It's a reminder that it's important to be kind, follow the rules, and make good choices. That's how we make our communities and our continent a happy and safe place for everyone.

Learning Together!

So, my dear friends, remember this story. It teaches us that doing the right thing is always the most important thing. And our amazing Africa is a continent full of beautiful places and kind people. Thank you for listening to the news today. Keep exploring, keep learning, and keep smiling! See you next time, from your African reporter!
summary: A rich man named Mr. Epstein wanted to buy a very fancy palace in Morocco, a country in Africa, but he was arrested for doing bad things just before he could buy it, so he never got the palace.
whyMatters: This story matters because it shows that everyone, no matter how rich, must follow the rules, and that bad choices can stop you from getting what you want, helping to keep our beautiful African countries safe and just.

title: Semenyo makes the difference as Man City beat Leeds
content: Antoine Semenyo's goal for Man City moments before half-time is enough to beat Leeds United and close in on leaders Arsenal in the Premier League.

originalTitle: Liverpool score five in dominant win over West Ham
title: Liverpool score five in dominant win over West Ham
content: Liverpool put five past West Ham United in a dominant performance that moves them up to fifth in the Premier League table.
